text: Richard "Dick" Balharry (24 May 1937 - 22 April 2015) was a Scottish conservationist, writer, and wildlife photographer. He was known for improving and protecting Scotland's natural landscapes. Just days before his death, he was given an award by the Royal Scottish Geographical Society (RSGS). Balharry was born near Dundee. He died from cancer on 22 April 2015, aged 77. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Scotland Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:People from Dundee Category:Scottish writers
title: Dick Balharry
